title: Christine Lampard reveals she met husband Frank by chance at the 2009 Pride of Britain Awards
text:
They have been happily married for nearly four years and have been together for a decade.

And Christine Lampard has revealed that she met husband Frank by chance at the 2009 Pride of Britain Awards.

The presenter, 40, also sweetly admitted that their baby daughter Patricia has 'completed' them as she spoke about her family in a candid interview.

Chance: Christine Lampard has revealed that she met husband Frank by chance at the 2009 Pride of Britain Awards (pictured this month)

Christine and Frank have been together since meeting at the 2009 Pride of Britain Awards in October, they tied the knot in a romantic ceremony at St Paul's Church, Knightsbridge, in December 2015.

The ITV star, who is on the judging panel of the 2019 Pride of Britain Awards, admitted that the awards ceremony is a special night for them.

She told the Mirror: 'It was a complete Sliding Doors moment, I still remember the first meeting as clear as day. Who goes to an awards ceremony and finds a husband? That was me!

'Neither of us were even meant to go and I was late after hosting The One Show. So when we are there now we do have a celebratory glass of champagne. It’s a special evening for us.'

Doting parents: The presenter, 40, also sweetly admitted that their baby daughter Patricia has 'completed' them as she spoke about her family in a candid interview (pictured after her birth in September 2018)

Christine and Frank welcomed their first child together, a daughter called Patricia named after his late mother who tragically passed away in 2008, in September 2018.

Frank also has daughters - Luna, 14, and Isla, 12, with his former partner Elen Rivas they split in 2008.

Talking about her daughter, Christine gushed to the publication: 'We were already really happy but I suppose it does complete things. I mean, goodness me, I still look at her now, a year old, and I honestly can’t quite believe she’s mine.'

The presenter admitted that she is 'utterly consumed' by Patricia and doesn't even know what they used to do before her.

Meant to be: She told the Mirror: 'It was a complete Sliding Doors moment, I still remember the first meeting as clear as day. Who goes to an awards ceremony and finds a husband? That was me!'

Christine also sweetly added that Frank has 'thrown himself into baby duties' with Patricia 'adoring' the former footballer and even looking like a 'mini Frank'.

The star shared the secrets of their relationship, admitting that they 'understand' each other's busy work schedules but they always make time for a 'good laugh' and 'conversation'.

Christine recently discussed how her body has changed since welcoming her baby daughter Patricia almost a year ago.

The TV presenter spoke to Fabulous about her figure, life as a mum to Patricia and how her body has changed since giving birth - as she revealed she has put on a stone and gone up a shoe size.

Motherhood: Talking about her daughter, Christine gushed to the publication: 'We were already really happy but I suppose it does complete things.'

She said: 'I’m wider all round [my waist and hips]. And I’ve gone up a shoe size since I had her! I could do more to try to trim myself back in, but I don’t care.'

After years of being pressured to start a family, Christine hit back: 'I didn’t give a s**t [about the pressure]. I just never got why it was a question. Whose business is it? And what difference does it make to anybody other than me?'

Along with not 'giving a s**t', she also insisted it is extremely poor form to grill a woman on whether or not she is set to start a family.

She went on: 'I think it’s always an awful question to ask a woman because no one knows what’s going on behind closed doors. Unless you’re within a really close circle, it’s nobody’s business.'
